summary:
I combine a robust and varied technical and analytical background with strong interpersonal skills and a passion for innovation. I am driven by technical excellence through the application of both novel and established technologies, and am delivery focused using pre-defined goals and deadlines. I see effective collaboration and communication with colleagues/stakeholders and a common purpose as key enablers.

My main technical expertise is in the field of petroleum/sediment/water geochemistry and the development and application of cutting-edge geochemical techniques/tools in both industry and academic research environments. I possess the unique ability to work on the interface between inorganic and organic geochemistry and am experienced in managing complex projects, including industry-academia collaborations, as well as translating and communicating outcomes to the non-expert community.

Specialties: Novel organic and inorganic geochemical proxies/tracers, (non-)traditional isotope geochemistry, metal geochemistry, source rocks, petroleum fluids (oil and gas), gas contaminants (CO2, Hg and N2), unconventional petroleum systems (tight gas/oil, oil shale), silica diagenesis, innovation, project management, mentoring/coaching.

profile_positions.description:
As team lead of the Geochemistry Experimentation team I am responsible for a state-of-the-art geochemical lab that (1) delivers end-to-end (from sample to interpretation), high quality advanced technical services to exploration and production assets around the globe, and (2) conducts cutting edge R&D focused on the development of novel technologies in support of New Energy solutions as well as efficient and economic resource extraction as part of the Energy Transition.

My responsibilities include:
- Developing a robust and fit-for-purpose research program that is aligned with the strategic aspirations of Shell’s Technologies including New Energies, and assure the technical integrity and timely delivery of R&D projects. 

-  Monitoring and assuring the delivery of reliable, timely and cost-effective laboratory/geochemical data for the generation of realistic subsurface models in support of investment decisions, concept selection, acreage acquisition, and new business development and to de-risk New Energy opportunities. 

- Maximizing the return on investment in laboratory facilities through prioritisation of inhouse vs. external analyses, analytical equipment upgrades and purchases, and assuring high capacity utilization as well as demonstrating business benefits realized from Shell’s laboratory capabilities. 

- Team leadership (8 experimentalists and geochemists) including staff management, appraisal and development, and project finance and budget management.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Geochemistry Experimentation

profile_positions.description:
My main responsibility is to influence Exploration and Development projects globally through deployment of  Geochemistry Laboratory capabilities, and to further develop these capabilities within Shell to meet future business demand and challenges.
 
Responsible for:
- Developing, maintaining and deploying industry-leading geochemical capabilities for Exploration and Development projects;
- Keeping abreast of competitor, industry, and academic developments in laboratory capabilities and applications. 
- Actively participate in the execution of the technology program focused on Exploration and Production Geochemistry and next generation fluid technologies.
- Demonstrating business benefits realized from Shell’s laboratory capabilities.
- Engagement with subsurface communities on high-end Technology projects.
- Training, mentoring and developing junior staff
- Ensuring technical integrity and delivery of the R&D programs
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Geochemist

profile_positions.description:
Geochemist in Integrated Charge Evaluation and Asset Geochemistry Team - Projects and Technology Upstream: Upstream Development

Provide geochemistry support to exploration teams (frontier and near-field) for evaluation/risking of business opportunities in the areas of hydrocarbon charge and fluid property prediction. 

» Responsible for appropriate application of geochemical technology, design and implementation of geochemical sampling and analysis programs, and interpretation & presentation of the resulting data in a multi-disciplinary context. 
» Provide geochemical input for regional and prospect specific basin modeling work, e.g. source rock characterization (properties and kinetics), petroleum fingerprinting, oil/gas-source rock correlations
» Act as technical focal point for hydrocarbon charge issues and liaise with geochemists in research teams to identify potential geochemical tools with business impact and lead the development and deployment of new and existing technology
profile_positions.title: Geochemist

profile_positions.description:
Research Geochemist in Basin Analyses and Inversion Team - Projects and Technology International: Innovation, Research and Development

Main responsibilities:
» Initiate, manage and coordinate external research projects with leading academic institutions incl. 
   - Oxford University: Metal isotopes in source rocks for advanced source rock evaluation and prediction
   - Bristol University: Metals in oil as novel tool for petroleum typing and fingerprinting
   - ETH Zurich: Noble gas in tight gas reservoirs as tracer for subsurface gas-water interactions and fluid transport mechanisms
   - Newcastle University: Palaeo-environmental reconstruction of the Jordan oil shale based on inorganic and organic geochemistry
   - Utrecht University - Geochemistry and palaeodepositional environment of the Libyan Silurian hot shale
   - Utrecht University/NIOZ - Construction of a trace metal database and the application of trace metals and XRF core scanning techniques for source rock evaluation studies
   - University of Houston - Re-Os dating of source rocks and hydrocarbons
» Supervision, mentoring and coaching of PhD and MSc students working on Shell funded projects
» Identify, develop and test novel organic (e.g. biomarkers) and inorganic (e.g. metal isotopes) geochemical tools for advanced source rock and petroleum fluid characterization
» Geochemical characterization of source rocks (RockEval, Leco, extract analyses) and petroleum fluids (bulk, molecular, isotope analyses) for Shell exploration teams
» Trained CAR (Capacity, Achievement, Relationships) assessor for Shell graduate recruitment days
